channel.title: Homes on Chico Q. Camargo
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Chico Q. Camargo

item.description: Hi, I’m Chico! I’m a Postdoctoral Researcher in Data Science at the Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford. I develop and apply computational tools to study collective human behaviour, focusing on public opinion dynamics, cultural evolution and urban mobility. I graduated with a BSc from the University of São Paulo, as part of the Molecular Sciences Programme, and later worked on mathematical modelling in biology at the Wolfson Centre for Mathematical Biology, and at the Department of Zoology, University of Oxford.

item.title: CV
item.description: Education D.Phil. (PhD) in Systems Biology, Brasenose College, University of Oxford, 2018 Thesis title: Genotype-phenotype maps for gene networks: from evolution to computation BSc., Molecular Sciences Programme, University of São Paulo, 2013 Academic Appointments 2018-present: Postdoctoral Researcher in Data Science, Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford 2017-2018: Research Assistant in Complex Networks, Oxford Internet Institute, University of Oxford Awards and Scholarships 2017: Finalist at the IOP Early Career Physics Communicator Award, Institute of Physics 2017: Hulme Completion Grant, Brasenose College, University of Oxford 2017: Vice-Chancellor’s Public Engagement with Research Award, University of Oxford 2017: First prize in the SocialHumanities Datahack, University of Oxford 2016: YouTube NextUP Award for BláBláLogia 2016: Senior Hulme Scholarship, Brasenose College, University of Oxford 2015: Public Engagement Award, DTC, University of Oxford 2015: PhD Symposium Best Short Talk Award, EMBL Heidelberg 2015: PhD Symposium Travel Award, EMBL Heidelberg 2015: Summer Research Course Award, Kavli Institute for Theoretical Physics, UCSB 2013-17: Clarendon Fund Scholarship Award, University of Oxford, awarded to top 2% graduates 2013: Undergraduate Research Scholarship, University of São Paulo 2012-13: Silver medal, iGEM Competition, USP-UNESP Team 2011-12: Undergraduate Research Scholarship, FAPESP, Brazil Publications {% for post in site.

item.title: Custom Section
item.description: This is an example of using the custom widget to create your own homepage section. To remove this section, either delete content/home/teaching.md or edit the frontmatter of the file to deactivate the widget by setting active = false.
